abstract.p: May 27 article comparing LeBron James of Cleveland Cavaliers to other NBA greats referred imprecisely to two defining plays involving Michael Jordan's Chicago Bulls in 1990s

block.p: A sports article on Sunday about late-game decisions by LeBron James of the Cleveland Cavaliers, and about how his development as a star player compares to that of other N.B.A. greats, referred imprecisely to two defining plays involving Michael Jordan's Chicago Bulls in the 1990s. It was Horace Grant, not Jordan, who passed to John Paxson for the title-clinching 3-pointer in the 1993 N.B.A. finals against Phoenix. And in the 1997 finals, Jordan's teammate Steve Kerr made a 2-point shot, not a 3-pointer, to lift Chicago over Utah.
